MULTIMODAL.title: Multimodal Transport
MULTIMODAL.description: A single shipment transported by multiple modes under one contract and one responsible party.

INTERMODAL.title: Intermodal Transport
INTERMODAL.description: A single shipment using multiple transport modes but with separate contracts and responsibilities.

COMBINED.title: Combined Transport
COMBINED.description: General term for using multiple transport modes without a precise legal framework.

THROUGH.title: Through Transport
THROUGH.description: Transport of cargo from origin to destination through consecutive stages, usually with one document.

DOOR_TO_DOOR.title: Door-to-Door Transport
DOOR_TO_DOOR.description: Comprehensive service from sender to receiver using one or more modes.

DOOR_TO_PORT.title: Door-to-Port Transport
DOOR_TO_PORT.description: Shipping responsibility ends when cargo arrives at the port.

PORT_TO_DOOR.title: Port-to-Door Transport
PORT_TO_DOOR.description: Shipping responsibility starts from the port until the receiver's door.

TRANSSHIPMENT.title: Transshipment
TRANSSHIPMENT.description: Transfer of cargo through an intermediate point to change transport mode without final delivery.

SEA_AIR.title: Sea-Air Transport
SEA_AIR.description: Combination of sea and air to balance speed and cost.

SEA_ROAD.title: Sea-Road Transport
SEA_ROAD.description: Sea transport followed by road transport to reach final destination.

RAIL_ROAD.title: Rail-Road Transport
RAIL_ROAD.description: Using trains with trucks in a single shipping journey.

SEA_RAIL.title: Sea-Rail Transport
SEA_RAIL.description: Combining sea transport with railways for long distances with higher efficiency.
